definition: tongue-twister
variant of 繞|绕[rao4], to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
see 令狐[Ling2 hu2]
classifier for a ream of paper
see 脊令[ji2 ling2]
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: You may try the tongue twister.
Can you read the following tongue twisters fluently?
sentences.chinese: 你能流利地朗读下面的绕口令吗？

sentences.english: He makes fun of me. but I'm a big fan of your aqua velva commercials.
sentences.chinese: 他在开我玩笑，不过我更欣赏你的绕口令表演。

sentences.english: Choose the No. from 10 tongue twisters in turn.
sentences.chinese: 小组轮流每次从10句绕口令中选取一个句子号码。

sentences.english: I found some 4)tongue twisters to help my pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 我找到一些绕口令来帮助练习我的发音。

sentences.english: We always practice our pronunciation with a tongue twister at the beginning of every lesson.
sentences.chinese: 每节课开始时我们总是用绕口令来练习发音。

sentences.english: Nest, I to a English tongue twisty everybody.
sentences.chinese: 下面，我为大家读一首英语绕口令。

sentences.english: I find English tongue twisters pleasant to learn.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得英语绕口令学起来很有意思。

sentences.english: Tongue twisters always frustrate me because I cannot say them correctly.
sentences.chinese: 绕口令一向让我很头大，因为我总是说错。

sentences.english: Tongue twister is a language game.
sentences.chinese: 绕口令是一种语言游戏。

sentences.english: The moment Master Chou finished his incredible tongue twister, audiences just went buzzing.
sentences.chinese: 周师傅一表演绕口令绝技之后观众就沸腾了。

sentences.english: Exercises like tongue twisters can help improve your flexibility.
sentences.chinese: 做一些如绕口令的练习可以帮助改善你的灵活性。

definition: nursery rhyme
nursery rhyme
to parrot/to repeat uncritically what sb says
popular piece of doggerel/common phrase repeated as a jingle
(of singing or speaking) very articulate pronunciation and vocalizing
comic monologue/one-person comic sketch
witticism/wisecrack/sarcastic remark/double entendre
allegro
clapper talk/patter song (in opera) with clapperboard accompaniment
to pronounce/pronunciation/to emit sound
to rhyme/sometimes written 壓韻|压韵
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
Chinglish
Mandarin (common language)/Putonghua (common speech of the Chinese language)/ordinary speech
riddle/conundrum/CL:條|条[tiao2]
beat boxing/vocal mimicry/ventriloquism
